summary: This document is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, outlining the distribution of his estate and the powers granted to his Executors. It details the responsibilities and authorities of the Executors, including financial management and the handling of assets, as well as provisions for potential conflicts of interest and the appointment of successor Executors. This document is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, outlining the distribution of his estate and the roles of the Executor and Trustee. It includes provisions regarding taxes and the handling of assets after his death.

events.title: Execution of Last Will & Testament
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein executed his Last Will and Testament in the presence of witnesses.

locations: St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The document is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, revoking all prior codicils.
Epstein appoints Darren K. Indyke, Richard D. Kahn, and Terje R. P-Larsen as Executors of his estate.
If any Executor is unable or unwilling to serve, Eva Andersson-Dubin, Kathryn Ruemmler, and Stephen Hanson are named as successor Executors in that order.
The Executors are granted broad powers to manage the estate without needing judicial approval for many actions.
The will includes provisions for the handling of assets and liabilities, as well as the responsibilities of the Executors.
The document outlines the distribution of Epstein's estate and the roles of the Executor and Trustee.
It includes provisions regarding the handling of federal and state taxes related to the estate.
The Will was executed on June 14, 2017, in the presence of witnesses Leo and Danna.
The document specifies that any beneficiary who contests the Will will be disqualified from receiving any benefits.
The Will incorporates the provisions of the Trust Agreement by reference.
